Air Quality Index (AQI) is increasing day by day and the impact is affecting the climate a lot. The change in the weather condition has worsened air quality.

• Air is the Earth's atmosphere. Air around us is a mixture of many gases and dust particles. It is the clear gas in which living things live and breathe. It has an indefinite shape and volume. It has no colour or smell. It has mass and weight, because it is matter. The weight of air creates atmospheric pressure. There is no air in outer space. 
• Air is a mixture of about 78% nitrogen, 21% oxygen, 0.9% argon, 0.04% carbon dioxide, and very small amounts of other gases.
• Air can be polluted by some gases (such as carbon monoxide), smoke, and ash. This air pollution causes various problems including smog, acid rain and global warming. It can damage people's health.
• The Air Quality data sources varies depending on the cities.

AQI LEVELS DEFINITION:

• Green: AQI (0 - 50) | Good
Air quality is considered satisfactory, and air pollution poses little or no risk

• Yellow: AQI	(51 -100) | Moderate
Air quality is acceptable; however, for some pollutants there may be a moderate health concern for a very small number of people who are unusually sensitive to air pollution.

• Orange: AQI	(101-150) | Unhealthy for Sensitive Groups
Members of sensitive groups may experience health effects. The general public is not likely to be affected.

• Red: AQI (151-200) | Unhealthy
Everyone may begin to experience health effects; members of sensitive groups may experience more serious health effects

• Purple: AQI (201-300)	| Very Unhealthy
Health warnings of emergency conditions. The entire population is more likely to be affected.

• Brown: AQI 300+	| Hazardous
Health alert: everyone may experience more serious health effects

วัตถุประสงค์ของโครงการ : เพื่อนำเทคโนโลยีด้าน IoT, Big Data และ Artificial Intelligent (AI) มาประยุกต์ใช้ประโยชน์ทางด้านตรวจวัดคุณภาพอากาศในมิติต่าง ๆ เช่น ปริมาณค่าฝุ่น ความกดอากาศ ปริมาณความชื้น อุณหภูมิ ความเร็วลม และทิศทางลม ภายใต้อุปกรณ์ตรวจวัดคุณภาพอากาศจำนวน 8,000 จุด ครอบคลุม 77 จังหวัดทั่วประเทศ เพื่อจัดเก็บและวิเคราะห์ข้อมูลและแสดงผล รวมถึงเชื่อมโยงสู่การประเมินโอกาสของเหตุการณ์ในอนาคตโดยเปิดให้หน่วยงานหรือบุคคลทั่วไปนำข้อมูลไปใช้ประโยชน์ในรูปแบบ Open Data เพื่อให้หน่วยงานทั้งภาครัฐบาลและเอกชนนำข้อมูลไปประยุกต์ใช้งานในด้านต่าง ๆ อาทิ การดูแลสุขภาวะประชาชนจากมลภาวะทางอากาศ โดยเฉพาะอย่างยิ่งฝุ่นขนาดเล็ก (PM2.5) การนำข้อมูลมาใช้ทางด้านการเกษตรหรือการท่องเที่ยว รวมไปถึงเชื่อมต่อในรูปแบบของ API สำหรับนักพัฒนาด้วย

Aura’s analysis & scoring systems are powered by Artificial Intelligence, that translates complicated weather-drone data into a score & friendly SIMPLE SENTENCES.

summary.label:
If you use this app, you can easily obtain "Temperature-humidity index(Discomfort Index)", "WBGT(Heat stroke index)", "Dew point temperature", etc., from weather information.
Furthermore, the app calculates the air condition from dry-bulb temperature(Td) and wet-bulb temperature(Tw) obtained by Assmann-Psychrometer, etc., and the app can also input atmospheric pressure.
The app can calculate 11 items and 13 indicators, and conversion to the Celsius temperature and SI units (or in the Fahrenheit temperature and Imperial and US customary measurement systems) also you can simply by switching of "Temperature Unit".
The items and indicators that this app can calculate are as follows.

- Dew Point Temperature
- Relative Humidity
- Humidity Ratio(Absolute Humidity)
    Weight absolute humidity
    Weight absolute humidity in the more smaller unit.
    Volume absolute humidity
- Humidity Deficit
- Enthalpy
- Specific Volume
- Equilibrium Vapor Pressure 
- Partial Pressure
- Boiling Point of Water
- WBGT(Estimated value)
- Discomfort Index[Temperature-humidity index] 

(( Supplementary explanation about the WBGT(Estimated value) and the Discomfort index.

The calculation formula of the outdoor WBGT is "WBGT = 0.7 Tnw + 0.1 Td + 0.2 Tg", but since there is no entry a item Globe thermometer temperature(Tg) in the app, so estimation the Globe thermometer temperature(Tg) by Dry-bulb temperature(Td).
- Calculation formula : "Tg = 1.45 Td - 27.162 [Temperature unit: ℉]”
There is a very strong correlation between Globe thermometer temperature(Tg) and Dry-bulb temperature(Td).
[Statistical information on this correlation : The number of samples is 17376 and the coefficient of determination(R^2) when statistics are taken is 0.919]

For natural wet-bulb temperature(Tnw), convert the Wet-bulb temperature(Tw) obtained by measurement by the Assmann Psychrometer to the Wet-bulb temperature(Tw) measured in natural state, a use it as Natural wet-bulb temperature(Tnw).
The natural state here means that the wind speed at the time of measurement is 5 meters per second(16.4 feet per second) or less.
The algorithm of this conversion is very special, so we omit the explanation.

"Discomfort Index" is "Temperature-humidity index".
The calculation formula is "Discomfort Index[DI] = 0.4 × (Td + Tw) +15 [Temperature unit: ℉]".  ))

If you want to get the current atmospheric pressure, the current dry-bulb temperature(Td) and the current wet-bulb temperature(Tw), tap the "Weather" information button. By the way, In iPhone6, etc., you can get the atmospheric pressure by pressing "MEAS" button.
You can choose conditions of the wet bulb is you can choose any one of the “Normal" or “Froze” (※ If you choose the “Froze”, setting is enabled in when if sub-zero in wet-bulb temperature(Tw) ).
Even if you enter the measurement value such as a non-draft type  psychrometer(for example, "Augusto Psychrometer", etc.), just tap the button and the corresponding value can be displayed (※ the app is subject to use of a ventilation type psychrometer in terms of measurement accuracy).
The app can receive the calculated value of dry bulb temperature (Td) and wet bulb temperature (Tw) from the sister app “Calculator of Air”.
If you use this function, you can input "dew point temperature", "relative humidity", etc. (※ there is a need to start up the "Calculator of Air" first).
Input range is the temperature is -30 ℃ to 50 ℃ (-22 ° F to 122 ° F), the atmospheric pressure is 600 hPa to 2475 hPa(17.72 inHg to 73.09 inHg).

This app is using the OpenWeatherMap(CC BY-SA4.0).


- Disclaimer 1.
Please input and use the temperature range(0 ℃ to 40 ℃ / 32°F to 104°F ) according to common sense as much as possible. If you enter an extreme value correct calculation result may not appear.

- Disclaimer 2.
We are not liable for any damage caused by the use of this application does not bear all of the responsibility.
